programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: A maximum field of 296 of the world's top bowlers compete for an $86,000 purse with the winner taking home $20,000 and the runner-up receiving $13,500; EJ Tackett of Blufton, Ind. enters the competition atop the PBA World Championship standings.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Christopher Bell made it three-straight wins following his victory at Phoenix over Denny Hamlin, while William Byron leads the points standings; Kyle Larson and Joey Logano won the two races at Las Vegas last year over Tyler Reddick and Bell.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: A maximum field of 296 of the world's top bowlers compete for an $86,000 purse with the winner taking home $20,000 and runner-up receiving $13,500; American Matt Russo took home the title in 2024 to capture his second career PBA Tour title.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton and St. John's split their two regular-season meetings, including a 57-56 Bluejays win on Dec. 31 behind 18 points from Steven Ashworth before a 79-73 Red Storm victory on Feb. 16 behind 23 points and 14 rebounds from RJ Luis Jr.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Christopher Bell made it three-straight wins following his victory at Phoenix over Denny Hamlin, while William Byron leads the points standings; Kyle Larson and Joey Logano won the two races at Las Vegas last year over Tyler Reddick and Bell.

programme.title: Walk-Off Stories
programme.desc: National League MVP Kirk Gibson, who was hobbled by leg injuries in the NLCS, was used as a pinch-hitter in Game 1 of the 1988 World Series, his only at-bat of the series, and would provide one of the most memorable home runs in MLB history.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Kyle Busch secured his 67th career Truck Series win with his victory at Atlanta over Stewart Friesen, while Grant Enfinger leads the standings; Rajah Caruth averaged 129.91 mph en route to his win at Las Vegas last year over Tyler Ankrum.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Kyle Busch secured his 67th career Truck Series win with his victory at Atlanta over Stewart Friesen, while Grant Enfinger leads the standings; Rajah Caruth averaged 129.91 mph en route to his win at Las Vegas last year over Tyler Ankrum.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Seventy-two of the world's top bowlers compete for a $200,000 purse with the winner taking home $30,000; E.J. Tackett, the three-time Chris Schenkel PBA Player of the Year (2016, 2023-24) is the only bowler with two victories this season.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Los Angeles and Portland split victories in their two meetings from the 2024 season, winning the final matchup on Sept. 18 with a 4-2 scoreline; Evander found the net with a brace for the Timbers after 51 minutes in the win at home.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez opened the season with a dominant victory at Thailand to gain an early eight-point lead over his brother, Alex Marquez; Marco Bezzecchi won the last race at Argentina in 2023 over Johann Zarco.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez opened the season with a dominant victory at Thailand to gain an early eight-point lead over his brother, Alex Marquez; Marco Bezzecchi won the last race at Argentina in 2023 over Johann Zarco.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Jorge Martin moved into first place and gained an 18-point lead over Brad Binder after winning the race at Portugal over Enea Bastianini for his first victory of the season; Alex Rins won the race at Texas last year over Luca Marini.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez opened the season with a dominant victory at Thailand to gain an early eight-point lead over his brother, Alex Marquez; Marco Bezzecchi won the last race at Argentina in 2023 over Johann Zarco.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton and St. John's split their two regular-season meetings, including a 57-56 Bluejays win on Dec. 31 behind 18 points from Steven Ashworth before a 79-73 Red Storm victory on Feb. 16 behind 23 points and 14 rebounds from RJ Luis Jr.

programme.title: Women's College Gymnastics
programme.desc: Utah claimed a 197.300-196.975 victory over UCLA in their lone meeting of the 2024 season on Feb. 19, 2024, after going down .425 at the midway point after bars and beam; Makenna Smith posted an event-high 9.900 on bars in the win on the road.

programme.title: The American Rodeo

programme.desc: The top anglers across the country compete in a series of annual events that makes up bass fishing's most competitive league, featuring millions of dollars in prizes, tournaments taking place throughout the U.S., and coverage of all the major phases.
